title: Organic No Till Farming For Home Gardeners and Commercial Farmers

tasks.task: Set up cover crop and use weed control fabric for no-till farming.
subtasks: Establish a diverse cover crop, including cowpeas, forage radish, black mustard, oats, and buckwheat.
Use a roller to crush the cover crop.
Lay down durable polypropylene weed control fabric.
Secure fabric edges with sandbags or water-filled hoses.
Allow fabric to cover the crushed cover crop for one week to kill remaining plants and weeds.
Remove fabric to plant corn transplants, utilizing the decomposing cover crop as natural fertilizer.

tasks.task: Implement no-till farming for nematode control.
subtasks: Plant a susceptible crop to attract nematodes.
Cover the crop with weed control fabric before nematodes can reproduce.
Allow the fabric to cover the plant for several days to kill the nematodes and the crop.
Remove fabric to plant a non-susceptible crop, eliminating nematode population.
